column4: Here is an odd question...  I have a problem with SSH.  When I connect to a remote computer through a VPN-connection, I can only run commands in the SSH session that has one-line responses ...except 'grep'.  i.e. and can write 'ls -all | grep r' and get a response, but no response when writing just 'ls' ...can't edit files with nano or view them with 'cat' ...what is the problem ?
the cursor freezes after the command line after I hit 'Enter'
sounds like the remote machine is having a problem
what is the linux version you are sshing into
no...it freezes completly ...can't even 'Ctrl-C' the session ...I have to close the whole Terminal window.
and what linux version are you sshing from
I have tried both Maverick and Lucid  (don't think its a client issue tho ...I just have multiple workstations here)
look in the syslogs on the remote machines, it's also possible it's the vpn link
I have issues in viewing files remotely ...as I can't 'cat' them .... if I know what I'm looking for I can 'grep' it and get a response.
if it was a routing problem the VPN-connection wouldn't be stable and there would be other symptoms is remote controlling it ...however the issue is very consistent.
(oh...when I say specific things I meant...a specific search-string)
the next best answer I'm looking for is a way of defining the problem, so I can go on a search.  It's just so weird to describe :-)
